newsitem.title: POLAND: FIVE NEW POLISH STOCKS TO START LIVE TRADE OCT 28.
newsitem.headline: FIVE NEW POLISH STOCKS TO START LIVE TRADE OCT 28.

text.p: The Warsaw Stock Exchange will add five new stocks to 10 issues already listed in the bourse's continuous trading system, the bourse said in a statement.
It said Animex, Wielkopolski Bank Kredytowy (WBK), Stomil Olsztyn, Okocim and Gorazdze would start trading on October 28.
The bourse said Animex, WBK and Okocim would trade in lots of 500 shares, Stomil would trade in 250-share lots and Gorazdze in lots of 100 shares.
Last month the bourse president Wieslaw Rozlucki said the exchange planned to trade live the main market's 20 most active and heavily capitalised stocks by the end of the year.
The issues in continuous trade are also traded on the main market under its single-price auction system.
